headline: Pork Chop and Potato Casserole
description: Everyone loves this pork chop casserole recipe. It's easy and delicious. Pork is baked in a creamy mushroom sauce with potatoes, onion, and cheese.
name: Pork Chop and Potato Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place pork chops in the oil, and sear.

Combine condensed soup and milk in a medium bowl. Arrange potatoes and onions in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place browned pork chops over potatoes and onions, then pour the soup mixture over everything in the dish.
Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Top with cheese, and bake for 30 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this today. I used 6 bone in pork chops. Cooking the chops 1hr at 400* was way too long and they were overcooked and dry. Next time I would brush some of the cream of mushroom/milk sauce on the chops and then add the chops the last half hour when you add the shredded cheese. I would put some of the shredded cheese on top of potatoes then put pork chops on top of potato mixture, then more shredded cheese on top of chops. I did try someone's comments about frying the sliced onions with garlic which added a nice taste to casserole. I also pre-seasoned pork and potatoes. Casserole tasted good, just chops too done... Definitely needed applesauce on the side.
Delishous!
I've made this recipe for years. I use golden mushroom soup when I have it on hand. Great flavor and presentation!
Fantastic meal! Easy, delicious-made it just as the recipe said. Served with a side of broccoli. It’s a keeper
Fantastic recipe

I took tips from the comments and put the chops on the bottom and then layered potatoes and added broccoli and some garlic and worcestershire. I also added cheese in bowl while mixing sauce. Can never have too much cheese! Cooked it 1/2 hr with foil on and 1/2 with foil off. Delicious.

This really is a very nice simple recipe. I've made it for years while kids were growing up. It is better with some fresh mushrooms, and garlic. And yes kids liked it all. Try sneaking in some broccoli for added nutrition.

It was good, but the pork chops did not turn out as juicy as I hoped. It was also a bit too much work to be worth the flavor outcome. However, if you love casseroles and especially ones with cream of mushroom/chicken/whatever soup, you should give it a try.

I've made a casserole similar to this numerous times. Of course, most of us have our own little tweaks that we seem to do with most recipes. Instead of slicing the potatoes, I quartered them like I do for a pot roast. My family loves the gravy, so I use 2 cans of soup and 2 cups of milk so there will be plenty of the gravy. I've sometimes also add green beans in with the casserole to make it a complete meal. Note: I also use this basic recipe substituting the pork chops with round steak.
Love this recipe! My husband like it too which is a complement! I didn't change anything.

I followed the recipe to a T and it came out watery. The milk probably wasn't necessary. It was very soupy. Also the person that submitted the recipe never specified whether to cover it or not. I did cover mine the first 30 minutes and after adding the cheese I removed when baking another 30 min. Honestly the people in the comments helped more than the person submitting the recipe.
Really good. Tender enough, and juicy...Made it exactly as per recipe stated.
Very simple to put together and delicious too. I combined & heated the milk and mushroom soup in the pan drippings before pouring it over the dish for a richer flavor.
I had bone-in center cut chops and used those instead. Plus, I used loaded baked potato soup since I didn't have cream of mushroom. My wife still loved it and asked me to make it again.

Easy
Tasty
Will make again.
Love this recipe. I added fresh mushrooms and loved it even better. Very rich and makes great leftovers.

Horrible ! I read the directions 4 times, when it said to cook the pork chops for an hour in a 400 degree oven. Went with it.... and after 45 minutes and the cheese burnt, I took them out and plated. Absolutely NO flavor and the pork chops as predicted were so dry we went through a gallon of apple sauce to choke them down.
Delicious!
Loved it!!!
My family loves this recipe. I actually added a generous sprinkling of HVR seasoning and 1/4 cup of x.sharp cheese to my milk soup mixture. Fabuloso!!
I changed mine up a bit. Mixed mushroom soup and can of cream corn. 1/2 can milk. Lots of butter. Was so good. Thks.

I made it and we loved it! We liked it so well I shared the recipe with friends and family. I sliced the potatoes about 1/4 inch thick just a personal preference and used 1 onion sliced 1/4" thick rather than diced....
This has become a standard in my household for sure. It's easy, quick and delicious! Thanks for a great recipe!!

I used cream of onion soup instead of cream of chicken, and I used a can of condensed milk (12 oz) mainly because I was out of regular milk. And I added a packet of onion soup mix and pounded the heck out of the pork chops with a meat tenderizer. My family liked this dish.
I was concerned with the hour cooking time but the pork chops were juicy and the potatoes were not overcooked. I would definitely make this for guests. I didn't change anything.
We all absolutely LOVED this recipe. Will be making again and again for sure!
I made it as is. Bland, bland, bland. Be sure to add your favorite spices to liven it up. Otherwise, try something else.
Very tasty. Used cream of celery soup. Also may try pork chops with bone since would be more tender. Used about 1 cup cheese. Very tasty. Will make it again
Great recipe! I used green onions

The dish is a simple one without much seasoning. I did modify it to use some eggplant that need to be eaten. Cut the pork chops into small cubes and used a seasoned flour. Browned the meat , using sliced thin fingerling potatoes and small cubed eggplant and onions diced. Used the cream of mushroom soup with a 1/2 of cup of water and poured it over the mixture and spread it out (it is thick because your eggplant will provide the liquid needed) cook as directed. Turned out great, but next time I would season the veggies tp add a nicer flavor to the dish.
Delicious! Will definitely make this again.
The pork chops were a little tough but mine were super thick. Other than that it was good

It was good! I am needing to find quick & easy for supper. I adjusted the seasoning by adding Tony's Creole. I kind of doubled recipe because I always have more folks eating with us. It turned out really good. The best thing was I had leftovers, so I cut up remaing pork chops and put that and the potatoes in a pot and warmed that up. It was yummy . Like potato soup with chops in it. For a rainy day, it hit the spot. I also caramelized the onion. Than you so much for this recipe

This is delicious! I used 1 potato cut in very thin slices and 5 small thinly sliced boneless pork chops. I added a can of drained French-style green beans and followed the rest of the recipe as is. It was enough for 2-4 people. I will add the recipe to my growing All Recipes folder.
Great
I’m rating this based on the ease of making it! The chops are in the oven so, I’ll rate again after dinner
Wow! Love this! Simple and delicious. Thanks for this.
Taste very good. My only suggestion would be to cook 15 mins less or add a little bit more milk. Pork chop was half tender half dry.

Based on prior reviews I made a few adjustments to this recipe. I fried the onions with some fresh mushrooms then seared the pork chops. I sliced the potatoes real thin and added them to the onion and mushroom mixture for a few minutes after the pork chops were done. I added a couple tablespoons of sour cream and a splash of white wine to the soup plus only 1/2 cup of milk. This modified recipe turned out really good.
Excellent recipe. I have a hard time getting pork chops to come out moist. This did it. Only change was in the servings. It is just my hubby and I. Will definitely make again.

This was a great recipe, I added some cream of sherry to the mixture and some more cream to make sure it was a great sauce mix. 
Husband said .. oh yea .. you can do this one again ... always good to hear !!!
Yummy. Picky husband loved it.
No changes. 2 chops for the two of us but kept other ingredients in the amounts listed.. Delicious. Will definitely make it again.
Not very well. Will not make it again
Peppered my pork chops when searing. Came out great. I like black pepper.

After reading so many comments I made small changes. Seared the chops with the onions. We like a little heat so I used a little Cajun Seasoning, Black Pepper, and Cayenne Pepper on the chops. Added minced garlic on top of the potatoes then the chops. Everything else the same from there. I will share that I only had 3 fresh potatoes so I used a can of Del Monte Fresh Cut Sliced New Potatoes and could not tell the difference. Came out delicious!

I made it with cream of chicken and cream of mushroom soups added parsley and put my pork chops in a cast iron skillet and added butter and salt and pepper and made them golden brown before baking and adding butter and boiled my potatoes first before throwing them all together to make them softer and added extra cheeses did everything else added little more milk though I used 4 big pork chops as well instead of 6
This was very good. I’ve made this for years without the cheese. This added such a nice touch, must say it was an improvement! Will be using this recipes from now on!
Supper easy. My husband doesn't like mushrooms so i used cream of celery instead with a little bit of pepper
Fantastic dish! My boys greatly approved...even the picky youngest ;)

3.5 stars. I avoid recipes that rely on cans of soup as one of the ingredients, I would rather make my own roux, sauce, gravy, etc. I sliced the potatoes thin, covered the dish for the full hour and still the potatoes were slightly underdone. I used the full cup of milk because I knew the dish would need the liquid to cook the potatoes. I seasoned the chops and dredged them in a light coating of flour before searing them. Over all...the dish was okay. I may make it again, but it didn't knock my socks off.
Not with the first couple times, but hubby wants me to make it with steak.... since I don’t eat meat, I’ll have to take his word on taste.

I will make it again. I don't slice the potatoes. I use baby red potatoes. When the taters are done to my liking and the chops can be sliced with a fork, it's time for dinner. Been eating it for many years. Is in most midwest church cookbooks.
Tasty!! I added some minced garlic, Italian seasonings to potatoes & seasoned the pork chops before searing. It was tasty

I was looking for a new/different way to make a pork chop dinner, and I came across this recipe. It was fabulous! So easy to make too. Very few ingredients, and the flavor; excellent. This is a definite repeat recipe for me.

I made it with 2 one inch pork chops so I cut the time down to 20 minutes, but I think the cheese should be added in from the start because they dried out a bit. And soup was a little too soupy. But very tasty.
My kids and I love this dish. It’s easy to make and doesn’t cost much either.

This definitely needs some help. Season the potatoes and pork chops for sure. Add cheese in between the layers of potatoes. Increase the milk by 1/4-1/2c. Add Panko on top of the cheese in the last step. The concept is good-the flavor needs help.
I made the dish according to the recipe, and it was delicious. My wife and I both enjoyed it. I plan to make it again.
This was easy to put together and very good. Did need to season with salt and pepper, would suggest adding to taste before baking.

Super easy and tasty. After reading other reviews i: seasoned the meat and potatoes with salt, pepper, garlic and onion; added cheese in the soup/milk sauce; added the porkchops for the last 20 min of bake time only.
Hubby and I both loved it!

I always read the reviews because I lack the courage of more experienced cooks to tinker with things. I used Lowreys on the chops before I cooked them. I always use it with pork. I used an whole onion and sauteed it with garlic and added pepper only and paprika. I used a whole cup of mile and not a half. I did not add any salt and it was fine. And I like my salt. I mixed the cheese in with the soup which is something we always do as we don't like toppings. And I used extra potatoes an d could have used even more. It was terrific. I will make this many times.
I did not have cream of mushroom soup or onions. So I substituted them with cream of bacon soup and shallots. Holy moly it was delicious!
I followed the recipe as written and it was fantastic!

I took this recipe and combined it with the Parmesan Sage Pork Chops from all recipes and it was delish. Sliced the potatoes then browned the chops with the parmesan crusted coating. Baked with the soup and milk mixture. Perfect
50 min. Then covered with cheese

Will definitely make it again! However, the recipe does not call for seasoning the chops before you sear them and you should always season meat when searing it, especially in a recipe like this where there isn't a lot of flavor in the other ingredients. My husband used a blended seasoning for pork on the pork steak we used instead of chops. Also, added french fried onions on top when added the cheese. Yum!!
I would recommend adding the soup only without the milk. It was almost too runny as it was without the milk.
I would recommend adding the soup only without the milk. It was almost too runny as it was without the milk.
This was delicious quick and easy. One thing to adjust will be 1O min less cooking time.Will make it again .
This was much better than I thought it would be

I would definitely make this again. It did seem a bit "oniony" for my taste, so will saute the onions prior to baking as one reviewer suggested. This dish is very close to one my mother-in-law used to make. It is delicious.
Didn't have enough flavor. Spiced up leftovers.....better.

I did it the way you have it here, and it was a amazing, yes I will do it again.

Thank you
No changes turned out good.
Definitely make it again. Followed the recipe
This was delicious!!
Really easy to make. Hubby said great! Lean pork chops a bit dry but still good!

My mom made this for years and it is comfort food for the winter. I followed others advice and did not add the water. When I seared the meat, I seasoned it with seasoning salt, pepper and paprika and added a 1/2 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce to the mushroom soup. The paprika gave it a nice golden hue when it was done. We lapped up the leftover gravy with bread after all the spuds and meat were gone. Thank you, I am a little too full now.
We added a few more spices. Will make again.
This was really easy to make, not overly expensive and very good!

I’m amused by the words “creamy mushroom sauce”. It’s a can of cream of mushroom soup with a little milk. Gross. Why not make mushroom gravy from mushrooms and butter? And use the pork chop skillet ?
I did. It was good.
This was a quick, easy recipe, and it came out delish!!!!! I doubled all the ingredients, cause I feed a gang. Everyone loved it! Thanks for sharing! This will be a pork chop favorite!

I precooked the potatoes in the microwave, so I could cut down on time in the oven. I also seasoned the pork chops with salt and pepper before searing them. Other than that I followed the recipe. My husband said he liked it, which is saying A LOT!

Yummy! I did sauté the potatoes and onions a bit in the pan that I seared the pork in before adding them to the casserole dish. I also completely forgot to mix milk with the soup, but it is still so so yummy!!
I thought this was really good! I did add some spices including some cayenne pepper to make it have a little heat and thought it was great! Will make again!
My husband loved it! We definitely will make it again!!!

We loved it, I did not use any onions and at the 30 minute point I added some frozen green beans. We will be making this again, but I will probably wait to put the cheese on until there is 10 minutes left

Recipe is a good base,but it definitely needs seasoning. Just use salt when browning chops otherwise the other spices will burn before you get a good sear. Add garlic powder and other spices when you layer the potatoes. I put the potatoes on top of the chops and it kept chops moist as well as letting the potatoes brown nicely when I uncovered for the last 10 minutes.

Loved it! I even used soy milk and dairy free cheddar. My pork got a little dry but I probably overcooked them on the stove. The second time I cooked it in the slow cooker and then baked it with the cheese to look pretty. The third time I put everything in the crock pot (chops still frozen) and it cooked all day- don't do that. It was way too liquidy. The pork chops should have been browned or at least thawed before going in the crockpot. My daughter's dairy free cheese doesn't melt nicely in the oven so I like to stir it in as things bake. Next time I'll stir in the cheese an hour before serving (using crock pot).
Like most people, I seasoned the pork and potatoes. Loved the flavour and will definitely make again.

This recipe was simple and easy to make. I read the other reviews and I agree to cut the milk to 1/2 cup. I browned the chops and also baked everything in a large cast iron skillet which worked perfect. The only addition I made was adding some cayenne to the pork chops prior to baking. Very hearty. filling meal that is great for wintertime dinner. Thanks for the recipe!
I dislike pork chops but I have now found a way I enjoy them. This was a huge hit at my house.
I mixed sharp cheddar cheese in with the mixture before pouring it on top of the pork chops and baked it for an hour. It’s delicious!
I made this straight by the recipe minus the onions and it was so delicious, my husband had two servings, I have never seen him eat that much in one setting.
This was very yummy! My son liked it, too, which is always a good thing!
Very delicious. I added herbs de Provence. Other that that, I stick to the recipe.
The flavor was really good and the pork chop was tender, but the potatoes did not cook all the way through. I think maybe should precook the potatoes a bit.
This is a awesome keeper. We all liked it
